1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob M Bacon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Jacob M Bacon was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob M Bacon is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Jacob M Bacon was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
DOC COLLECT
------------------------------------------

Obtain and maintain full time employment.
------------------------------------------

No contact with victim or her mother or their residence without their consent and the consent of the Agent. No contact with any minors except for incidental contact without the permission of Agent. 
------------------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
------------------------------------------
 Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
------------------------------------------
Comply with all sex offender treatment.
------------------------------------------
Lifetime registration as sex offender. 
------------------------------------------
Restitution is held open for sixty (60) days.

IT IS ORDERED that unless the Statement on Transcript is filed within five days of the date of this order and a copy of the statement is served on the clerk of the circuit court, the appeal in the above matter will be subject to penalty under Rule 809.83.

Motion on Postconviction relief before the Honorable Phillip Koss on December 2, 2019
Court Reporter Brady Bish
Statement on Transcript regarding postconviction motion
Statement on the Transcript
Original Order to Produce filed with Court.
Notice of Appeal and Circuit Court Record received by COA.
Denying Defendant's Postconviction Motion

02:27 PM   Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Jacob M Bacon in court, in custody with Atty Jeffrey Jensen.  
2:30 pm  Atty MacKenzie Renner is sworn & testifies on direct exam of Atty Jensen.  
2:53 pm  Cross exam of Atty Renner by ADA Johnson.  
2:58 pm  No redirect.  
2:58 pm  Atty MacKenzie makes statement.  
2:59 pm  Follow-up question by Atty Johnson.  
2:59 pm  Atty Johnson wishes to supplement record and references letters in the court file.  
3:00 pm  Atty Jensen has nothing further to add to that.  
3:01 pm  Court has reviewed the case and did preside over the trial.  
3:01 pm  Argument by Atty Jensen in support of Motion.  
3:08 pm  Argument by Atty Johnson.  
3:12 pm  Response by Attys to Court's question.  
3:13 pm  Court makes record.  There are 2 issues today:  Is there a  violation of speedy trial right;  He did assert that right on 9/16/2016 and the trial was then held in May of 2018.  Court looks at the reasons for delay. There were requests also because there were multiple attorneys on this case.  Court did specifically address the defendant about speedy trial demand at the time he was released from custody on a signature bond.  Court does not believe Atty Renner was ineffective for not pursuing the speedy.  And there is no actual prejudice in this case.  The 2 year delay made it more difficult for the victim.  Court does not believe there is a speedy trial delay that resulted in any prejudice to this defendant so that even if Ms. Renner was ineffective for not pursuing that that remedy there was no prejudice.  Court does not believe she was ineffective.  Court does not believe there is any prejudice in this case.  Defendant's Motion is denied.  3:31 pm  Attys do not have any other issues that they wish the Court to address.  3:32 pm  Atty Jensen will submit an Order.  
3:32 pm  Court in recess.

records.addlTxt:
2:32 pm  Defendant Jacob M Bacon in court, in custody with attorney Mackenzie Renner.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:32 pm  Court has reviewed PSI.
2:32 pm  ADA Johnson has reviewed PSI and has no corrections.
2:32 pm  Attorney Renner has reviewed PSI and has some corrections and recites them for the record.
2:34 pm  No victim impact statement or claim for restitution.
2:35 pm    Court gives WARNINGS regarding deportation, felon prohibited from firearm possession pursuant to Sec. 941.29, ineligibility to vote until civil rights restored, prohibition of child offender working with children pursuant to Sec. 948.13 
2:37 pm  Sentencing argument and recommendation by ADA Johnson.
2:41 pm  Sentencing argument and recommendation by Attorney Renner.
2:46 pm  Defendant does not wish to make a statement.
2:46 pm  Court having heard arguments of both sides is ready to proceed to sentencing.
2:47 pm  Court has reviewed PSI and goes over SM-34 factors.
3:07 pm  Court imposes following sentence:

Forty (40) years in Wisconsin State Prison System bifurcated as twenty-five (25) years Initial Confinement followed by fifteen (15) years Extended Supervision
Three hundred sixty-nine (369) days dead time credit

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

Costs including supervision fees
No contact with victim or her mother or their residence without their consent and the consent of Agent
No contact with any minors except for incidential contact without the permission of Agent
Restitution is held open for sixty (60) days
Counseling as recommended by Agent
Comply with all sex offender treatment
Lifetime registration as sex offender
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge
No weapons or firearms
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.

Sentencing hearing on July 31, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

2:58 pm  Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:06 pm  Jury in courtroom and seated in jury box.  Court thanks the Jury for their hard work.
3:06 pm  Court addresses foreperson who advises Court that they have now reached unanamious verdicts on all counts.
3:07 pm  Court reviews verdicts forms and finding them to be in order reads them aloud:

Not Guilty of 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Sexual Contact with a Child Under Age 13, as charged in Count 1 of the Information
Guilty of 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Sexual Contact with a Child Under Age 13, as charged in Count 2 of the Information
Not Guilty of Exposing Genitals or Pubic Area, as charged in Count 3 of the Information


3:08 pm  These were and are their verdicts so sayeth they all.
3:09 pm  ADA Johnson does not wish to have the Jury be polled.
3:09 pm  Attorney Renner does not wish to have the Jury be polled.
3:09 pm  Court gives final instructions to Jury, thanks them for their service and excuses them.
3:10 pm  Jury released.
3:11 pm  ADA Johnson moves for judgment on Count 2.
3:11 pm  Attorney Renner moves for judgments on Counts 1 and 3 and moves for judgment notwithstanding verdict on Count 2 based on inconsistency.
3:12 pm  Court enters judgment of acquittal on Counts 1 and 3 and enters judgment on Count 2.
3:12 pm  Court will order a PSI.  Defendant is already in custody serving a sentence but Court will revoke bond.  
3:12 pm  Court directs Attorney Renner to make arrangements now if she intends to obtain an independant PSI rather than waiting for court ordered PSI to come back.
3:15 pm  Court adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 31, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

11:01 am  Defendant Jacob M Bacon in court, in custody with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Johnson advises Court that Judge Hue allowed her to review Jefferson Co records but she could not disclose records to anyone else.
Judge Hue directed a Sullivan analysis be done by this Court prior to release of any records.
Attorney Johnson filed a Bellows motion which was not heard by Judge Hue.
Court hears from Attorney Anderson who concurs that Judge Hue would not allow any records to be disclosed even for an offer of proof and that penalities for doing so  were quite clear.
Court does not find State has met burden of proof and Court will not contact Judge Hue.
Confirmed for trial.
